snippet: Protestant protesters stormed onto the grounds of the Belfast City Hall on Monday after the City Council’s Catholic majority voted to remove the British flag from the building for most of the year.
abstract: Protestant protesters storm onto grounds of City Hall in Belfast, Northern Ireland, and clash with police after City Council's Catholic majority votes to remove British flag from building for most of year.
lead_paragraph: Protestant protesters stormed onto the grounds of the Belfast City Hall on Monday after the City Council’s Catholic majority voted to remove the British flag from the building for most of the year.

headline.main: Northern Ireland: Vote on British Flag Divides Belfast
headline.print_headline: Northern Ireland: Vote on British Flag Divides Belfast
